basics.name: Lizyl Failano
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Fall, 2024.

highlights: Examine vouchered claims against the State to ensure appropriateness and compliance with laws and regulations.
Review payroll claims for compliance with established laws and policies.
Supervise or participate in clerical pre-auditing for vouchered and payroll claims, ensuring adherence to various regulations.

work.summary: 'Imi Na'auao STEM Peer Mentor for ICS, Spring 2023
highlights: Support students in STEM courses (ICS 111, ICS 141, ICS 211, ICS 212) by aiding comprehension of course materials, offering assignment/project guidance, and promoting collaborative learning.
Foster student growth, achievement, and professional development in alignment with the principle of ʻimi naʻauao (seeking knowledge)
Facilitate mentor and mentee success in their STEM education journey, cultivating a supportive, knowledge-sharing community at Kapiʻolani Community College.
Maintain accurate merchandise data across POS systems
Generate reports and ensure timely updates
Support strategic initiatives through admin tasks and communication.

volunteer.organization: Fall 2022 and Spring 2023 Student Undergraduate Research Fair (SURF)
volunteer.summary: The annual event, hosted by Kapiolani Community College, showcases student research and provides valuable research experiences.
highlights: Guidance: Assist presenters with last-minute instructions and ensure a smooth transition between speakers.
Presentation Setup: Prepare presentation rooms for student researchers to showcase their projects.
Technical Support: Address and resolve any technical issues with AV equipment or materials.
Order and Environment: Maintain an organized and conducive presentation environment.
